meanings.definition: To inhale audibly through the nose to detect a smell.
meanings.sent1: The dog sniffed the flower to smell its sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent2: She sniffed the air cautiously, trying to identify the source of the delicious aroma.
meanings.sent3: The detective sniffed around the crime scene, hoping to catch a whiff of any clues.
meanings.sent4: As she walked through the bakery, the delightful scents enveloped her like a warm hug she sniffed in deeply.
meanings.sent5: The chef sniffed the spices, savoring each aroma before adding them to the dish.

meanings.definition: To inhale audibly through the nose to express disdain or scorn.
meanings.sent1: He sniffed in disapproval at the messy room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher sniffed at the poorly written essay, disappointed in the lack of effort.
meanings.sent3: The cat sniffed haughtily at the new brand of food, as if it was beneath her refined taste.
meanings.sent4: She sniffed at the idea of going to the party, finding it utterly boring.
meanings.sent5: The old man sniffed at the young boy's suggestion, thinking it naive and impractical.
